Verification of worst air quality claim: The expert analyzed news reports and rankings from AirVisual, an air monitoring service, to confirm that Seattle did have the worst air quality in the world on August 21, 2018.
Confirmation of one: day occurrence: The expert verified that the claim of the worst air quality in Washington was accurate for one specific day, based on the data from AirVisual and Seattle news reports.
Role of climate change: The expert acknowledged that climate change played a role in exacerbating the wildfires and subsequently worsening air quality, supporting the larger point made by the claim.
Other contributing factors: The expert noted that while climate change was a factor, there were also other elements that contributed to the wildfires and poor air quality, implying that it was not solely attributable to climate change.
